alert.note: Alert for Madison; Page; Rappahannock (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 09 at 12:33AM EDT until June 09 at 1:15AM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: The National Weather Service in Sterling Virginia has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... North central Madison County in northwestern Virginia... Central Page County in northwestern Virginia... West central Rappahannock County in northwestern Virginia... * Until 115 AM EDT. * At 1232 AM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Stanley, or 19 miles northeast of Harrisonburg, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Damaging winds will cause some trees and large branches to fall. This could injure those outdoors, as well as damage homes and vehicles. Roadways may become blocked by downed trees. Localized power outages are possible. Unsecured light objects may become projectiles. * Locations impacted include... Luray, Stanley, Sperryville, Alma, Kimball, Compton, Leaksville, Ida, Hamburg, Fourway, Fairview, Five Forks, Panorama, Skyland, Rileyville and Honeyville. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
